Know your rights when voting!

Make a plan to vote. You can find important information about voting at aclupa.org/vote.

Know Your Rights

{include "default_salutation"} –

You're probably seeing a lot of information out there about voting in this election. ACLU-PA is here to cut through the noise and provide you with what you need to know about voting. Check out our voting rights resources at aclupa.org/vote, which is regularly updated as new information becomes available.

A few things to remember:

  • If you plan to vote by mail, apply now! The deadline to apply is October 27, and the deadline to mail it or deliver it is November 3 (Election Day). But please, don't wait. Apply now at votesPA.com and submit your ballot as soon as you can to avoid mail delays.
  • You've probably heard a lot about "naked ballots" lately. Because of a recent state Supreme Court ruling, you must place your mail or absentee ballot into the secrecy envelope that comes with it, or your vote will not be counted.
  • If you're planning to vote in person, make sure to double-check your registration status (just to be sure!) and look up your polling place before you go at votesPA.com. Many polling places will change this year.
  • Keep the nonpartisan election protection hotline handy. If you have any questions about voting, see misinformation about the voting process, or want to report a problem, call 866-OUR-VOTE. Trained nonpartisan volunteers can help you.

Our vote is our power, and, to exercise that power, voters need to know all of the important details about voting. To promote voter knowledge and empowerment, ACLU-PA and Common Cause PA have teamed up to create a Voting Ambassador program to help educate voters. Learn more at aclupa.org/votingvolunteers.

Your vote is your power. Make a plan to vote and know your rights.

ACLU of {affiliate_name}
